00048 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 // singleton template manages setting/resettting global variables.
00050 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051 
00052 template <class T>
00053 class singleton
00054 {
00055         T m_OldValue;
00056         T* m_pGlobalValue;
00057 
00058 public:
00059         singleton(T newValue, T* globalValue)
00060         { 
00061                 m_pGlobalValue = globalValue;
00062                 m_OldValue = *globalValue; 
00063                 *m_pGlobalValue = newValue;
00064         }
00065 
00066         ~singleton() { *m_pGlobalValue = m_OldValue; }
00067 };
00068 
00070 // optional.h
00071 //
00072 // An isolation point for optionality, provides a way to define
00073 // objects having to provide a special "null" state.
00074 //
00075 // In short:
00076 //
00077 // struct optional<T>
00078 // {
00079 //     bool m_bValid;
00080 //
00081 //         T    m_data;
00082 // };
00083 //
00084 //
00085 
00086 #include <new>
00087 #include <assert.h>
00088 
00089 class optional_empty { };
00090 
00091 template <unsigned long size>
00092 class optional_base
00093 {
00094 public:
00095     // Default - invalid.
00096 
00097     optional_base() : m_bValid(false) { }
00098 
00099     optional_base & operator = (optional_base const & t)
00100     {
00101                 m_bValid = t.m_bValid;
00102                 return * this;
00103     }
00104 
00105         //Copy constructor
00106     optional_base(optional_base const & other)
00107                 : m_bValid(other.m_bValid)  { }
00108 
00109         //utility functions
00110         bool const valid() const                { return m_bValid; }
00111         bool const invalid() const              { return !m_bValid; }
00112 
00113 protected:
00114     bool m_bValid;
00115     char m_data[size];  // storage space for T
00116 };
00117 
00118 template <class T>
00119 class optional : public optional_base<sizeof(T)>
00120 {
00121 public:
00122     // Default - invalid.
00123 
00124     optional()   {    }
00125     optional(T const & t)  { construct(t); m_bValid = (true);  }
00126         optional(optional_empty const &) {      }
00127 
00128     optional & operator = (T const & t)
00129     {
00130         if (m_bValid)
00131         {
00132             * GetT() = t;
00133         }
00134         else
00135         {
00136             construct(t);
00137                         m_bValid = true;        // order important for exception safety.
00138         }
00139 
00140         return * this;
00141     }
00142 
00143         //Copy constructor
00144     optional(optional const & other)
00145     {
00146                 if (other.m_bValid)
00147                 {
00148                         construct(* other);
00149             m_bValid = true;    // order important for exception safety.
00150                 }
00151     }
00152 
00153     optional & operator = (optional const & other)
00154     {
00155                 assert(! (this == & other));    // don't copy over self!
00156                 if (m_bValid)
00157                 {                                               // first, have to destroy our original.
00158                         m_bValid = false;       // for exception safety if destroy() throws.
00159                                                                 // (big trouble if destroy() throws, though)
00160                         destroy();
00161                 }
00162 
00163                 if (other.m_bValid)
00164                 {
00165                         construct(* other);
00166                         m_bValid = true;        // order vital.
00167 
00168                 }
00169                 return * this;
00170     }
00171 
00172 
00173         bool const operator == (optional const & other) const
00174         {
00175                 if ((! valid()) && (! other.valid())) { return true; }
00176                 if (valid() ^ other.valid()) { return false; }
00177                 return ((* * this) == (* other));
00178         }
00179 
00180         bool const operator < (optional const & other) const
00181         {
00182                 // equally invalid - not smaller.
00183                 if ((! valid()) && (! other.valid()))   { return false; }
00184 
00185                 // I'm not valid, other must be, smaller.
00186                 if (! valid())  { return true; }
00187 
00188                 // I'm valid, other is not valid, I'm larger
00189                 if (! other.valid()) { return false; }
00190 
00191                 return ((* * this) < (* other));
00192         }
00193 
00194     ~optional() { if (m_bValid) destroy(); }
00195 
00196         // Accessors.
00197 
00198         T const & operator * () const                   { assert(m_bValid); return * GetT(); }
00199         T & operator * ()                                               { assert(m_bValid); return * GetT(); }
00200         T const * const operator -> () const    { assert(m_bValid); return GetT(); }
00201         T               * const operator -> ()                  { assert(m_bValid); return GetT(); }
00202 
00203         //This clears the value of this optional variable and makes it invalid once again.
00204         void clear()
00205         {
00206                 if (m_bValid)
00207                 {
00208                         m_bValid = false;
00209                         destroy();
00210                 }
00211         }
00212 
00213         //utility functions
00214         bool const valid() const                { return m_bValid; }
00215         bool const invalid() const              { return !m_bValid; }
00216 
00217 private:
00218 
00219 
00220     T const * const GetT() const { return reinterpret_cast<T const * const>(m_data); }
00221     T * const GetT()                     { return reinterpret_cast<T * const>(m_data);}
00222         void construct(T const & t)  { new (GetT()) T(t); }
00223     void destroy() { GetT()->~T(); }
00224 };
